caption.title: Accuracy of prediction of FluoroMyelin in human brain tissue slices across two developmental points (GW20 and GW24).
caption.p: Median values of the Pearson correlation (r) and structural similarity index (SSIM) between predictions of image translation models and target fluorescence. We evaluated combinations of retardance (ρ), orientation x (ωx), orientation y (ωy), phase (Φ), and brightfield (BF) as inputs. These metrics are computed over 15% of the fields of view from two GW20 datasets and two GW24 test datasets. The 2D models take ∼ 4 hours to converge, whereas 2.5D models take ∼ 64 hours to converge.
